meanings.definition: To remove stress or tension from.
meanings.sent1: After a long walk in the park, she destressed by reading her favorite book.
meanings.sent2: She destressed by taking a warm bath after a hectic day at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat destressed by curling up in a cozy spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The destressed clouds finally released their rain after a hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: He destressed his mind by practicing mindfulness and deep breathing exercises.

meanings.definition: To treat (a material) in order to relieve internal stresses.
meanings.sent1: The metal was destressed to ensure it would not break under pressure.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was destressed before being used in the production of the new clothing line.
meanings.sent3: The wood was destressed to prevent warping and cracking over time.
meanings.sent4: The destressed glass was carefully inspected for any imperfections.
meanings.sent5: The engineer destressed the structure to enhance its durability and longevity.
